name: Lincoln: The Personal Side Quiz | Abraham Lincoln | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Nancy and Thomas.

	Nancy Hanks and Thomas Lincoln were the parents. Anne and William were the Shakespeares; Anne and Charles were the Lindberghs. Sally and Thomas is a reference to Thomas Jefferson and Sally Hemmings.

questions.text: Lincoln's mother died young. What was the cause of her death?
questions.explanation:
'Milk Sickness'.

	'Milk Sickness' apparently occurs when cows eat poisonous plants and pass the poison along (via their milk) to humans. Ann Rutledge, alleged to be Lincoln's 'true love', died of what was then called 'brain fever'.

questions.text: What happened to Lincoln after the death of his mother?
options: He was raised by an aunt
He was raised by his father
He went out on his own
questions.explanation:
His father remarried.

	Thomas re-married and Lincoln had a step-mother, Sarah. Apparently, Lincoln and Sarah got along quite well.

questions.text: Who was Lincoln's closest friend from his days as a young man?
questions.explanation:
Joshua Speed.

	Speed was a very close friend, although the friendship weakened after both married. Denis Hanks was Lincoln's cousin. John Hay was a biographer of Lincoln who served with him in the government during Lincoln's presidency.

questions.text: What was NOT true of Mary Todd?
questions.correct: Her marriage to Lincoln was marred by her infidelity
options: She was prone to overspending while First Lady
She was vindictive and held grudges
questions.explanation:
Her marriage to Lincoln was marred by her infidelity.

	Poor Mary went through quite a lot in her life. She suffered from chronic headaches (and from {depression); she could also be vindictive and unforgiving. She also antagonized many by her spendthrift ways. There was, however, never any charge or suspicion of infidelity.

questions.text: What did Lincoln have in common with Mary Todd?
questions.correct: Each lost a parent while young
options: They belonged to the same social class
They were similar in physical appearance
Each grew up in the same geographic region
questions.explanation:
Each lost a parent while young.

	Each lost a mother while young: Lincoln was nine and Mary was seven. Mary was from a decidedly more affluent and social background than Lincoln. Lincoln, of course, was tall and thin; Mary was short and a bit 'plump'.

questions.text: Which is true of Lincoln's marriage to Mary Todd?
questions.explanation:
They had sons only.

	Robert, Eddie, Willie, Tad.

questions.text: How many of Lincoln's children lived to maturity (beyond a teenager)?
questions.explanation:
1.

	Robert went on to Harvard, became Secretary of War, made quite a bit of money and enjoyed prominence in his full life. The other sons, however, died young.

questions.text: What statement is true of Mary Todd?
questions.correct: She was institutionalized for a while, then released
options: She was institutionalized and spent the end of her life in confinement
All attempts to institutionalize her failed
A first attempt to institutionalize her failed, but a second attempt succeeded
questions.explanation:
She was institutionalized for a while, then released.

	She was institutionalized for a while, but later released after a second proceeding declared her sane.

questions.text: Lincoln's death coincided with what holiday?
questions.explanation:
Easter.

	He was shot on Good Friday and died on Saturday. The following day was Easter Sunday.
